intro: Uvaria zschokkei, commonly known as the black pepper tree, is a tropical plant belonging to the Anacardiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its dark, glossy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that start green and mature to a dark purple or black color. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some medicinal uses in traditional medicine. The tree can grow up to 10 meters tall and thrives in humid, warm climates.
